verses.name: Proverbs 26:1
verses.text: As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honour is not seemly for a fool.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:2
verses.text: As the bird by wandering, as the swallow by flying, so the curse causeless shall not come.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:3
verses.text: A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, and a rod for the fool’s back.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:4
verses.text: Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:5
verses.text: Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:6
verses.text: He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off the feet, and drinketh damage.
